job_details.degree_required: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Technology

primary: Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to solve complex programming issues
all: Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to solve complex programming issues

jd:
Hello Vendors,

I hope this email finds you well. We are currently seeking a .Net developer for an exciting opportunity in Indianapolis, IN. Please review the job details below and let us know if you are interested.

We are looking local candidates from INDIANA Only- 10+ years of exp

Skills
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Information Technology – Required
- Working experience with ASP.NET – Required, 10 years
- Working experience with C# and MVC – Required, 5 years
- Work experience in analyzing and addressing security-related issues for applications built in multiple languages – Required, 5 years
- Working experience with Oracle – Required, 5 years
- Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related fields with IT experience – Required
- Healthcare EDI experience – Highly desired
- Expert understanding of SDLC – Highly desired
- Current working experience with Web Services – Highly desired
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills – Highly desired
- Ability to solve complex programming issues – Highly desired
- Experience in the health industry – Highly desired

Essential Duties / Responsibilities:
- Responsible for complete SDLC for project assignment and participate in full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design.
- Working with technical and functional staff on detailed business requirements, understanding business processes and technology, agency standards, federal and state policies to align with project’s goals.
- Write technical specifications based on conceptual design and stated business requirements.
- Use object-oriented techniques and best practices for design, development, unit testing, and deployment.
- Development of code along with unit testing strategy & plans.
- Use Microsoft .NET Framework and a supported MVC framework, C# programming language to development of the applications.
- Work with Project Manager to ensure project plan is maintained and project milestones are being met.
- Work with PM, technical staff, and end user to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs of the application.
- Have ability to work independently with less guidance and work with ISDH externals partners as needed.
- Take agency web applications architecture and business decisions into consideration for design.
- Have ability to work independently and under general supervision with latitude for independent judgment.
